data.title: Traces
data.statement:
You are given an integer [[t]] for the number of tests. Each [[test]] is a space separated string containing three substrings: [[base]], [[target]], and [[fixed]].

For each [[test]], print {{true}} if you can go from [[base]] to [[target]] by swapping, any amount of times,  <<adjacent>> letters that are not in the [[fixed]] string, or {{false}} if you cannot.

testCases.title: 1. Base rules
testCases.testIn:
4
race care e
care race e
race care r
race care a

testCases.title: 1. Base rules val
testCases.testIn:
4
race care r
race care a
race care e
care race e

testCases.title: 2. Different lengths
testCases.testIn:
4
flat float l
bigstring smolstring s
ar erase r
boyo boy y

testCases.title: 2. Different lengths val
testCases.testIn:
4
boyo boy y
flat float l
bigstring smolstring s
ar erase r

testCases.title: 3. Same set
testCases.testIn:
4
capes cepas p
tanis tansi n
alert alter l
alerts stelar a

testCases.title: 3. Same set val
testCases.testIn:
4
capes cepas p
alerts stelar a
tanis tansi n
alert alter l

testCases.title: 4. >1 letter
testCases.testIn:
4
race care ar
tanis tansi ta
malin calin alin
ballots ablltos ls

testCases.title: 4. >1 letter val
testCases.testIn:
4
tanis tansi ta
race care ar
ballots ablltos ls
malin calin alin

testCases.title: 5. Edge cases
testCases.testIn:
5
abbca abbac b
abac acab bc
code code code
test tset t
abcd abdd d

testCases.title: 5. Edge cases val
testCases.testIn:
5
code code code
abac acab bc
abbca abbac b
abcd abdd d
test tset t

testCases.title: 6. Final
testCases.testIn:
10
true false e
vhmtlstucop vmhtlstucop copls
aaaab aaab b
bnoykcvqwlvtgz bnoykqvcwlvtgz tgzwk
molo oolm l
np np p
gedsmxbeoikafzjtdlp gesdmxeboikatjzdflp lpikamx
aaaaa a a
lhjgsmwanlkuod lhjgsmwankulod dngs
end end end

false
true

true
false
true

true

data.constraints:
Every character of [[base]], [[target]] and [[fixed]] is a lowercase letter of the alphabet.
There are no duplicate characters in [[fixed]]
Every character in [[fixed]] appears at least once in [[base]] and once in [[target]]
0 < length([[test]]) < 256
data.stubGenerator:
read t:int
loop t read base:word(200) target:word(200) fixed:word(200)

write For each of the t tests: true or false
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> An integer [[t]], the number of tests.
<<Next [[t]] lines:>> A space separated string [[test]] containing three substrings: [[base]], [[target]], and [[fixed]].
data.outputDescription: [[t]] lines, each containing the answer {{true}} or {{false}} to the corresponding [[test]].

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given an integer t for the number of tests. Each test is a space separated string containing three substrings: base, target, and fixed.

For each test, print true if you can go from base to target by swapping, any amount of times, adjacent letters that are not in the fixed string, or false if you cannot.
Input
Line 1 : An integer t, the number of tests.
Next t lines: A space separated string test containing three substrings: base, target, and fixed.
Output
t lines, each containing the answer true or false to the corresponding test.
Constraints
Every character of base, target and fixed is a lowercase letter of the alphabet.
There are no duplicate characters in fixed
Every character in fixed appears at least once in base and once in target
0 < length(test) < 256
Example
Input
4
race care e
care race e
race care r
race care a
Output
true
true
false
false
